description: Erection of first floor rear extension.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The facing materials used in the development to which this permission relates shall match those of the existing building(s) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall take place until a construction phasing/management plan/schedule has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The construction plan shall detail the phasing/schedule of construction works to ensure that the works to each property are undertaken simultaneously and substantially completed (walls and roof constructed, fenestration in place, internally habitable) within 3 months of each other. The development shall then be undertaken in compliance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure that the works to each property are undertaken simultaneously and completed and that their amenities are preserved in accordance with  in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Safety Report prepared by Bennet Architecture submitted 22nd December 2022 unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.
